reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice pair of retro clip headphones
reviews.reviewText: While they're nothing compared to my Sony WH-1000XM4's, they are very comfortable with my ear shape, and the sound quality is more than adequate to enjoy, but still hear what's going on around you. Also, I've seen comments about why one side is longer than the other, you're supposed to wrap the longer wire around your neck so you can let them drape off you if you need to take them off your ears.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cheap and Excellent Sound and Comfort
reviews.reviewText: So I usually pop these on in bed to listen to a book or short movie while falling asleep. Had previously used insertable, but those tend to cause issues once you doze off. These little guys work well, sound well, and the external hook design is easily put on and taken off without unnecessary pressure. You aren't going to want these things if you plan on exercising or moving around a lot, but for laying back and listening, they are a perfect match! Price ain't all that bad either considering where these devices are falling on the scale lately.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2016
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Right price for what I needed
reviews.reviewText: This is my second pair of clip over the ear headphones. My last pair (Phillips) I had many moons ago used to have a separate rubber piece on the curved part that fits behind the ear (likely to increase the traction with the skin and for comfort) and one day in the school gym it mysteriously fell off and was lost and it never clipped on the same again.I purposefully bought these Panasonic ones for travelling and because I couldn't argue with the price. They are very very slim and lightweight. And the bonus is I can wear them comfortably with my glasses on (I couldn't with my previous pair). I got red so I love the colour. Given how much I paid for it, it does look a bit cheaply made and the sound isn't awesome. But then again I was sitting over the wing of the airplane so the lyrics of the music started sounding like chipmunks. However, outside of the plane ride I think the sound was decent. It's not like you expect it to be noise cancelling. But I didn't get any noise leaking. And the passengers next to me didn't complain when I amped up the volume.Using it while working out though...while I was on an inclined bench it does have the tendency to fall off. So gravity is not its friend.I think if you're going to use these occasionally but you need to have a pair around so you don't bother the person you're working next to, it's a decent buy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 28, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exactly what I was looking for!!!
reviews.reviewText: First, I can't stand ear buds. They don't fit right, they are painful (even the foam tip ones), and I always need to take them out every so often, just because of the painful pressure on my ear walls.These sit very comfortably on the ear itself, just like an "old fashioned" headphone would, but without the band that would rest on the crown of your head. Instead, they rest on the top of each ear, but they are so light I hardly notice. The only time i felt the need to take them off for a little bit was 5 hours into a study session; even then 10 minutes later I put them back on for the rest of the session.Something that can be a plus or a minus is that they aren't noise-blocking, the way tight earbuds can be. For me, this was a bonus, as I want to have more awareness of the world around me as I go on walks, but if you're going to be spending 80% of your day writing the next great American novel in the local coffee shop, you should probably spring for over the ear cup headphones.My only complaint is that one of the ear's cables is longer than the other. I presume this is so that the cable can be shorter, and thus less likely to tangle, but I'm not sold on that. Still, I barely notice.If you dislike/hate earbuds, but still want to wear something over the ear (so you can wear a cap as an example), I strongly recommend you give these a shot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Compact and affordable
reviews.reviewText: I'm one of those folks who just can't wear earbuds. They are uncomfortable and they tend to fall out. So I got these to replace a similar pair from Koss. I needed a straight connector plug instead of the right angle plug to work with my new iPad and cover. The pros: plug fits fine with iPad cover in place, they are very compact and seem comfortable (haven't used them yet for an extended period). The cons: sound quality is fine with dialog, pretty bad for music (absolutely no bass) and the cord for the right ear phone is weirdly longer than the one for the left (this would seem to be a completely avoidable manufacturing defect). Overall, I'm giving them a pretty good rating, simply because they meet the limited needs I have for them (mostly watching Nexflix on an iPad). Skip these if you want them for music. The similar ones from Koss sounds way better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Earbuds always fall out, these don't.
reviews.reviewText: Not everyone likes wireless. Not everyone likes one more thing on their list of things to recharge. Not everyone's ears are compatible with earbuds (every pair I've tried fall out immediately). These headphones stay on, they never need charging and the sound quality is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars failed after 5 months of use
reviews.reviewText: not happy with quality of product. trusted Panasonic to be of better quality. guess not so anymore. yes, these are cheap headphones, but failing after normal use for 5 months is not acceptable. headphones are now mono, not stereo.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wife loves these
reviews.reviewText: Great product at a good price. Very clear and good quality

Panasonic really got it right with these headphones.I've never heard sound quality this good at this price.At this price most headphones I've tried have too much bass or sort of like the the sound waves are bouncing around in an empty sodapop can.Also if you wear glasses as I do you won't find these uncomfortable to wear.

As a Neurodivergent person I HATE earbud things that go in my ear, and I can't stand having my whole ears/head covered by normal headphones, but I still want an option for not playing sound out loud. This is the perfect compromise, I find them so comfortable, easy to use, to wear, to take off, and so nice on my ears, no squishing, stretching, crowding, or cramping. And the sound quality is great!
Most comfortable headset I've had for falling asleep to music
Economical. Comfortable. Very good sound. Can't wear earplugs. This is the best alternative I have ever come across.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pésimo producto, dejó de funcionar a un mes de compra
reviews.reviewText: Pésimo producto, dejó de funcionar a un mes de la compra
